intro: Schkuhria senecioides, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring dark green, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its showy yellow-orange flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Schkuhria senecioides is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in full sun.
